page.title: 03RYSHWORTH MIDDLE SCHOOL
page.content: Ryshworth Middle School was built in 1975,although it was founded the year before.The school is situated on the edge of the Leeds and Liverpool canal. The school uniform was introduced in the Autumn of 1984.Ryshworth's School colours are bottle green and tangerine,the school crest bears a golden eagle. The school has been involved in many fund-raising events such as: The 1985 17 mile sponsered walk for LEPRA. Also we have produced many plays and concerts such as Peter Canwell's "Carrots" in aid of Doctor Barnado's. The school building was designed in an "open-plan" style of ten parts, they are :the four years, each comprising of four classrooms,three cloakrooms,one shared area,two wet bays,four storerooms and two sets of toilets.The staff rooms,the gym,the
